qas.question: Where is Tyson Research Center located?

answers.text: west of St. Louis on the Meramec River

qas.question: When did Washington University acquire the property for Tyson Research Center?
What is the function of Tyson Research Center?

answers.text: a biological field station and research/education center.

qas.question: When was the Living Learning Center accredited as a "living building"?
Who previously owned the property where Tyson Research Center is located?
In what year was the Living Learning Center established?
How big is the Washington University campus?
Besides the Living Learning Center what was the other building accredited as a "living building"?
In what year was the Living Building Challenge issued?

context: <b7_0>Tyson Research Center<b7_0/> is a <b6_0>2,000-acre<b6_0/> (809 ha) field station located <a0_0>west of St. Louis on the Meramec River<a0_0/>. Washington University obtained Tyson as surplus property from <a4_0>the federal government<a4_0/> in <a1_0><b5_0>1963<b5_0/><a1_0/>. It is used by the University as <a2_0>a biological field station and research/education center.<a2_0/> In <a3_0><b8_0>2010<b8_0/><a3_0/> the Living Learning Center was named one of the first two buildings accredited nationwide as a "living building" under the Living Building Challenge, opened to serve as a biological research station and classroom for summer students.
